description: Design tokens distilled from the provided Blue Yard mood board. These values encode the pastel‑gradient aesthetic, generous whitespace and sober typography seen across the screenshots. Colors are grouped into functional roles (backgrounds, foregrounds, primary accents, neutrals) rather than raw hues. Sizes are defined in rems for easy scaling.

primary.description: Pastel lavender used for the hero and call‑to‑action highlights.

secondary.description: Mint/turquoise accent drawn from the biology & chemistry slide.

tertiary.description: Soft rose accent used in the utopia/oblivion panels.

highlight.description: Warm golden highlight inspired by the disco ball reflections.

background.description: Default page background – a near‑white neutral that lets pastel gradients pop.

foreground.description: Primary text colour. Dark enough for AA contrast on light backgrounds.

muted.description: Light neutral for cards and panels; carries a hint of purple to blend with backgrounds.

border.description: Neutral border colour for delineating components without drawing attention.

card.description: Surface colour for cards and elevated panels in light mode.

notes.mood: Ethereal and optimistic. The interface floats on pastel gradients reminiscent of dawn skies and nebulae. Text remains crisp and dark to ensure readability, while interactive elements are highlighted with gentle colour shifts. Motion should be restrained – subtle fades, slides and tilts that respect prefers‑reduced‑motion settings.
notes.contrast: The palette favours light backgrounds with high‑contrast dark text in light mode, and the inverse in dark mode. Primary and secondary accents are deliberately pale; rely on hover states and shadows rather than saturated colours for emphasis.
